questionText: What is object-oriented programming (OOP) in Java?
option1: A programming paradigm based on the concept of objects
option2: A programming paradigm based on the concept of functions
option3: A programming paradigm based on the concept of variables
option4: A programming paradigm based on the concept of modules
correctOption: A programming paradigm based on the concept of objects

questionText: What is a class in Java?

option1: The mechanism by which one class acquires the properties and behavior of another class
option2: A way to define multiple classes in a single file
option3: A way to override methods in a subclass
option4: A way to create an object of a class
correctOption: The mechanism by which one class acquires the properties and behavior of another class

option1: The ability of a method to do different things based on the object that it is acting upon
option2: The ability to define multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
option3: The ability to hide the implementation details of a class
option4: The ability to access members of a class without creating an object
correctOption: The ability of a method to do different things based on the object that it is acting upon

option1: The bundling of data with the methods that operate on that data
option2: The process of converting objects into bytes
option3: The process of making a class available to other classes in the same package
option4: The process of making a class available to other classes in different packages
correctOption: The bundling of data with the methods that operate on that data

questionText: What is the difference between == and equals() method in Java?
option1: == compares object references while equals() method compares the content of objects
option2: == compares primitive data types while equals() method compares object references
option3: == compares the content of objects while equals() method compares object references
option4: == compares object references while equals() method compares primitive data types
correctOption: == compares object references while equals() method compares the content of objects

questionText: What is a constructor in Java?
option1: A special type of method that is used to initialize objects
option2: A method that is called automatically when an object is created
option3: A method that is used to destroy objects
option4: A method that is used to create new objects
correctOption: A special type of method that is used to initialize objects

questionText: What is a static method in Java?
option1: A method that belongs to the class rather than to any instance of the class
option2: A method that is called automatically when an object is created
option3: A method that is used to destroy objects
option4: A method that is used to create new objects
correctOption: A method that belongs to the class rather than to any instance of the class

questionText: What is the purpose of the 'final' keyword in Java?
option3: and prevent method overriding and class inheritance
correctOption: To allow method overriding and class inheritance
column11: To make methods and classes unchangeable
column14: and prevent method overriding and class inheritance

questionText: What is exception handling in Java?
option1: The process of handling runtime errors gracefully to prevent program termination
option2: The process of generating errors during program execution
option3: The process of handling compilation errors
option4: The process of handling logical errors
correctOption: The process of handling runtime errors gracefully to prevent program termination
